job_title: Operations Assistant/Fitness Instructor in Oxford, England
pros:
Competitive pay
Ability to get away with doing nothing...
cons:
From the very top right the way down to the general managers, no one in this company cares the slightest bit about their employees. Constantly chucking on more and more pressure and delegating more and more of their responsibilities because the company is doing so badly that whenever someone leaves, they can't afford to replace them and so they merge job roles.

There is no communication at all. Literally none. Higher ups don’t even say hello, even those based on site. There’s absolutely no chance of an update of the Centre or the Company, you’re left to work it all out for yourself.

My mental health has declined massively over the year that I have worked here. I am one of few people that care about the job that I do (I shouldn’t but the customer’s matter to me) and this leads me to have so much work and so much stress with absolutely no help and no support from management.

review_title: staff are treated like working monkeys on minimal pay.
job_title: Senior Sales Advisor/Duty Manager in Leatherhead, England
pros: no pro's for the company however the staff within Leatherhead Leisure are brilliant just very demotivated.
cons: Poor poor communication from head office and DBM's. Fusion do not look after their staff. Being an employee for 4 years. There is no job satisfaction, no rewards. Not even Christmas party budget at the end of the year. Worked about 3 different job roles at the same time as they were cutting budgets left right and centre. Staff being treated like monkeys working on minimum pay and never any acknowledgement. Pay roll and head office have no idea what they are doing. And when a customer is genuinely trying to speak to head office regarding a complaint they have removed their contact details off the website so it's impossible therefor customers get frustrated with their centre staff instead. Never had any thank you's for over times or 100% mystery shops that they bang on about so much. Minimal communication between head office and higher management with the centres managers which is obviously very important. Over all the worst company I have ever worked for. Fusion need to understand that they have some brilliant employee's within their centres but they are so demotivating they are losing a lot of their best and replacing them with people that aren't half as good as the pay keeps dropping.
